channel.description:

item.title: Attempt at 3d cube
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Actually pointillism != stippling. Pointillism uses contrasting primary colors whereas stippling uses grayscale.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“yakman, post:35, topic:267473”]ill just take the example of pointillism, i didnt find that on wikipedia but remembered it then searched.
for a start its nothing to do with 3d graphics or computers at all, its a fine art technique.[/quote]
Pointillism is a pain in the ass form of art, which is probably why I suck at it…
/offtopic

Sexy cube I see there.

item.title: Attempt at 3d cube
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:31, topic:267473”][quote author=Greeny link=topic=353150.msg2709565#msg2709565 date=1237226619]
It’s like intellectual vs flame king.
[/quote]educated by wikipedia != intellectual[/quote]

lucky for me im not educated by wikipedia, see my next point

[quote=“frank_, post:31, topic:267473”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=353150.msg2709750#msg2709750 date=1237235381]
Wikipedia was created as a resource for anyone to use, no matter what generation. If you are ignorantly saying that it is not useful or cannot help you, then you are the most idiotic person I have ever met, simply out of sheer ignorance.
[/quote]i never said it isnt helpful, but using only wikipedia is fucking dumb[/quote]

who on earth said use only wikipedia?

ill just take the example of pointillism, i didnt find that on wikipedia but remembered it then searched.
for a start its nothing to do with 3d graphics or computers at all, its a fine art technique.

Read full topic

item.title: Attempt at 3d cube
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:11, topic:267473”][quote author=yakman link=topic=353150.msg2708109#msg2708109 date=1237127695]

matrices are hard, true story

please elaborate
[/quote]
they are bloody easy, nearly every single graphics library uses them

anyone got any ideas on how to shade the faces?

my idea is to have many many points that fill up the volume of the cube, then transform them all and draw a dot there.
but that would be massivly slow and wouldnt actually shade them, the cube would become Pointillism

i had forgotten until now that you are an example of the pathetic group that is the wikipedia generation. protip: rasterisation[/quote]

your generation made my generation into what we are.

everytime we ask a question we get told to google it, is it really surprising we use wikipedia for absolutely everything?

Read full topic
